hsDashboard.title: HS Dashboard: All‑in‑one Application Control
hsDashboard.subtitle: Like a unified feed for your school—aggregate every application, link, essay, edit, and checklist in one place. No more juggling Google Docs or spreadsheets.

hub.title: Single hub for all links and portals
hub.desc: Common App, Coalition, university portals, financial aid, recommenders—organized per student and per university.

write.title: What to write, when to write
write.desc: Auto‑surfaced prompts and requirements by university; outlines generated in KR/EN with cultural alignment.

workflow.title: Edit workflow built‑in
workflow.desc: Track drafts, feedback cycles, and approvals—no external docs required.

checklists.title: Live checklists before submit
checklists.desc: Essay uploaded, supplements complete, recommendations sent, testing reported—everything checked off in one view.

oversight.title: School‑wide oversight
oversight.desc: Counselor dashboards to monitor progress across cohorts with alerts and deadline risk flags.

hero.title: Built for High Schools, Counselors, and Students
hero.subtitle: Replace scattered docs with one command center for applications, essays, and deadlines.

items.dashboard: Unified dashboard for every student and university
items.prompts: Auto‑curated prompts and KR/EN outlines per university

pricing.title: Simple pricing
pricing.subtitle: Per‑student or school‑wide plans. Education discounts available.

q1.q: Can we import existing Google Docs?
q1.a: Yes. Drag‑and‑drop or paste links; we keep structure and history.

q2.a: Students sign in normally; counselors get school‑level permissions.

q3.a: Full KR/EN prompts, outlines, and review workflows are supported.

storytelling.title: Cultural Storytelling
storytelling.description: Learn to effectively communicate your Korean cultural background
storytelling.example1: Explaining family importance through Chuseok traditions
storytelling.example2: Emphasizing perseverance and diligence learned from Korean education culture
storytelling.example3: Sharing leadership experiences through traditional cultural activities

context.title: Cultural Context Understanding
context.description: Understand how Korean culture is perceived in U.S. universities
context.example1: Reframing Korean collectivism as collaboration and teamwork
context.example2: Explaining Korean education's competitive nature as achievement motivation
context.example3: Presenting traditional cultural values from a global perspective

language.title: Language Adaptation
language.description: Learn to express Korean thoughts naturally in English
language.example1: Appropriately translating Korean idioms to English
language.example2: Explaining Korean cultural context to English readers
language.example3: Restructuring Korean thinking patterns into Western logic

values.title: Cultural Values
values.description: Learn how to appeal Korean cultural values to U.S. universities
values.example1: Expressing filial piety as responsibility to family and society
values.example2: Explaining Korean diligence as achievement-oriented attitude
values.example3: Connecting traditional cultural wisdom to modern problem-solving skills
